commit.message:
Display errors relating to gists (#570)

Adds new dialogs that appear whenever an error occurs in the GitHub gist process.

Includes special messaging for these common cases:

- Closing the GitHub authorization window too early
- Clicking "Cancel" instead of "Authorize" in GitHub authorization
- Trying to load an invalid gist ID

Other exceptions will display as "Unexpected error" with whatever details were in the exception. GitHub backend errors will have a little more information, such as the API we were trying to call.

In all cases we include a link to file an issue on this repo in case the error persists.

If you want to test the sign in errors, you'll need to de-authorize the testing app, assuming you already signed in last time. You can either click "Revoke all user tokens" to do so for everybody: https://github.com/organizations/lit/settings/applications/1722323 -- or you can do it just for yourself from https://github.com/settings/applications.

Part of https://github.com/lit/lit.dev/issues/533

Display errors relating to gists (#570)

Adds new dialogs that appear whenever an error occurs in the GitHub gist process.

Includes special messaging for these common cases:

- Closing the GitHub authorization window too early
- Clicking "Cancel" instead of "Authorize" in GitHub authorization
- Trying to load an invalid gist ID

Other exceptions will display as "Unexpected error" with whatever details were in the exception. GitHub backend errors will have a little more information, such as the API we were trying to call.

In all cases we include a link to file an issue on this repo in case the error persists.

If you want to test the sign in errors, you'll need to de-authorize the testing app, assuming you already signed in last time. You can either click "Revoke all user tokens" to do so for everybody: https://github.com/organizations/lit/settings/applications/1722323 -- or you can do it just for yourself from https://github.com/settings/applications.

Part of https://github.com/lit/lit.dev/issues/533
